completeness.description: The degree to which the given task has been fully addressed by the proposed solution.

correctness.description: The accuracy of the solution provided by the multi-agent system.

efficiency.description: The efficiency of the solution in terms of the steps taken and resources used.

relevance.description: How relevant the steps taken by the agent are in relation to the final goal.

traceability.description: The ability to follow the logical reasoning or path taken by the agent to arrive at the solution.

adaptability.description: How well the system can adapt to new or changing information as the task progresses.

robustness.description: The multi-agent system's ability to handle errors, unexpected inputs, or challenging situations without failing.

clarity.description: The clarity of communication between agents and the transparency of the process.

originality.description: The level of creativity and originality in the approach to finding the solution.

scalability.description: The ability of the multi-agent system to handle scaling up, in terms of handling more complex tasks or a greater number of tasks.
